meanings.definition: A principle or standard by which something may be judged or decided
meanings.sent1: The teacher used the criterion of neat handwriting to evaluate the students' work.
meanings.sent2: In art class, creativity is an important criterion for grading the projects.
meanings.sent3: The criterion for choosing the best costume was the most colorful one.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness became the criterion by which he measured all his friendships.
meanings.sent5: The criterion of honesty shines brightly in her character.

meanings.definition: A rule or test for judging or evaluating something
meanings.sent1: The safety criterion for the experiment was wearing protective gear.
meanings.sent2: The criterion for passing the driving test includes demonstrating proper signaling.
meanings.sent3: The criterion for winning the game was to score the most points.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to practice became the criterion for his success in sports.
meanings.sent5: The criterion of excellence guided their decision-making process.
